pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:0.5: 81. The training rule on what is worn out
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Rājagaha in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrel sanctuary.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.2: At that time Venerable Dabba the Mallian, who was the assigner of dwellings and the designator of meals,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.3: had a robe that was worn out.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.4: Just then the Sangha had obtained robe-cloth,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.5: and it gave it to Dabba.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.6: The monks from the group of six complained and criticized it,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.7: “The monks are diverting the Sangha’s material gains according to friendship.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.8: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.9: “How can the monks from the group of six give out robe-cloth together with a complete Sangha and then criticize it afterwards?” …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.10: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.13: “… Foolish men, how can you give out robe-cloth together with a complete Sangha and then criticize it afterwards?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.14: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.15: And, monks, this training rule should be recited thus:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.16: ‘If a monk gives out robe-cloth together with a complete Sangha and then criticizes it afterwards, saying, “The monks are giving out the Sangha’s material gains according to friendship,” he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.1.4: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a complete Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.1.6: belonging to the same community, staying within the same boundary.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.1.8: one of the six kinds of robe-cloth, but not smaller than what can be transferred.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.1.12: according to friendship, according to companionship, according to who one is devoted to, according to being a co-student, according to being a co-pupil.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.1.14: given to the Sangha, given up to the Sangha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.1.16: robe-cloth, almsfood, a dwelling, and medicines; even a bit of bath powder, a toothbrush, or a piece of string.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.1.18: when robe-cloth has been given to someone who is fully ordained and who is the assigner of dwellings or the designator of meals or the distributor of rice-porridge or the distributor of fruit or the distributor of non-staple food or the distributor of minor requisites, and he has been agreed upon by the Sangha as such, then if a monk criticizes it, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.2.1: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, and he perceives it as legitimate, and he criticizes it when robe-cloth has been given, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.2.2: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but he is unsure if it is, and he criticizes it when robe-cloth has been given, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.2.3: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but he perceives it as illegitimate, and he criticizes it when robe-cloth has been given, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.2.4: If he criticizes it when another requisite has been given, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.2.5: When someone who is fully ordained is the assigner of dwellings or the designator of meals or the distributor of rice-porridge or the distributor of fruit or the distributor of non-staple food or the distributor of minor requisites, but he has not been agreed upon by the Sangha as such, and a monk criticizes it when robe-cloth or another requisite has been given to him, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.2.6: When someone who is not fully ordained is the assigner of dwellings or the designator of meals or the distributor of rice-porridge or the distributor of fruit or the distributor of non-staple food or the distributor of minor requisites, whether he has been agreed upon by the Sangha as such or not, and a monk criticizes it when robe-cloth or another requisite has been given to him, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.2.7: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but he perceives it as legitimate, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.2.8: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but he is unsure if it is, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.2.9: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, and he perceives it as illegitimate, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.3.2: if he criticizes one who regularly acts from desire, ill will, confusion, or fear, saying, “What’s the point of giving it to him—he’ll ruin it and not make use of it in an appropriate way”;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.3.4: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.3.5: The eleventh rule, the training rule on what is worn out, is finished.
